output.conclusion: This course provides a solid foundation in fluid mechanics, equipping you with the knowledge to analyze and solve a wide range of fluid flow problems. Further study and practical application are encouraged to deepen your understanding.
output.introduction: Welcome to Intermediate Fluid Mechanics! This course builds upon introductory concepts and delves into more advanced topics, including viscous flow, boundary layers, and turbulence. We will explore both theoretical principles and practical applications.

chapters.description: Review of viscosity concepts, Newtonian and non-Newtonian fluids, surface tension phenomena, and capillary action.
Pressure distribution in static fluids, hydrostatic forces on curved surfaces, buoyancy and stability.
Derivation and physical interpretation of the Navier-Stokes equations, simplifications for specific flow conditions.
Couette flow, Poiseuille flow, and other analytical solutions for simple geometries.
Prandtl's boundary layer equations, laminar and turbulent boundary layers, boundary layer separation.
Blasius solution for laminar flow over a flat plate, approximate methods for boundary layer analysis.
Characteristics of turbulent flow, Reynolds decomposition, Reynolds stresses.
Overview of different turbulence models (e.g., k-epsilon, k-omega), their applications and limitations.
